result.execSummary:
The defendant John K Hoffman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property >$5000-$10,000, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: 01/12/18: The Court extends probation for an additional year; as soon as Mr. Hoffman pays off restitution to Bethesda, Mr. Hoffman's probation can terminate. Remaining costs and fees, including restitution to insurance company is to be reduced to civil judgment. [JOC to be amended]

miscConds.notes:
--to pay restitution "1st priority" to Bethesda Lutheran Homes in the amount of $10,000
--to pay restitution "2nd priority" to Philadelphia Indemnity Insurance Co. in the amount  of 4667.56 
--to pay the 10% restitution processing fee
--The Court orders once Mr. Hoffman's bank account becomes unfrozen,he is to pay his Probation Agent $3700 in restitution within 5 business days.
--to pay costs of  $268 plus the $250 DNA surcharge, plus $225 in subpoena fees

--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment
--to undergo  any other assessment, treatmen and counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program or combination as approved by the Agent
--no contact with Bethesda Lutheran Homes
--no contact with Jack Vater OR Brian Thompson OR Paul Gieschen
--no presence at any scrap metal or recycling yard without express approval of agent
--to  comply with DNA sample provision to the DOC or designee upon demand

Arresting Agency: WTPD

  If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

[MA]Case called at 2:00pm 
Defendant John K Hoffman in court.  Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court reviews memo from probation agent requesting extension of probation
--ADA Hall agrees
--Mr. Hoffman does not take a position

The Court extends probation for an additional year; as soon as Mr. Hoffman pays off restitution to Bethesda, Mr. Hoffman's probation can terminate. Remaining costs and fees, including restitution to insurance company is to be reduced to civil judgment. [JOC to be amended]

Mr. Hoffman updates his address to: 903 S. University Beaver Dam 53916
recess: 2:06pm

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 3:08pm[MO]
Defendant John K Hoffman in court with Attorney David Zarwell.  ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Sentencing arguments given by ADA Teuber and Atty. David Zarwell.

On Amended Count #1, the Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 3 years, with conditions:

--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment
--to undergo  any other assessment, treatmen and counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program or combination as approved by the Agent
--no contact with Bethesda Lutheran Homes
--no contact with Jack Vater OR Brian Thompson OR Paul Gieschen
--no presence at any scrap metal or recycling yard without express approval of agent
--to pay costs of  $268 plus the $250 DNA surcharge, plus $225 in subpoena fees
--to  comply with DNA sample provision to the DOC or designee upon demand
--to pay restitution "1st priority" to Bethesda Lutheran Homes in the amount of $10,000
--to pay restitution "2nd priority" to Philadelphia Indemnity Insurance Co. in the amount  of 4667.56 
--to pay the 10% restitution processing fee
--The Court orders once Mr. Hoffman's bank account becomes unfrozen,he is to pay his Probation Agent $3700 in restitution within 5 business days.


Days credit for time already served:  1 day
Felony firearm/voting prohibition warnings given
recess:3:20pm
Sentencing hearing on February 13, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
with JI's and criminal case settlement agreement forms attached.

Case called at 10:41 am [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Sarah O'Brien presiding for BrIV]
Defendant John K Hoffman in court with Attorney David Zarwell. ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Zarwell requests matter be set out for sentencing as there are pending negotiations re: restitution
On Motion of the State, the Court AMENDS Count #1 to a lesser degree of Theft, contrary to 943.20(1)(a) & (3)(b), a Class H felony

Constitutional rights given; plea of "Guilty" entered; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.
Recess: 10:49 am

Jury trial on January 26 & 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.

of intent to admit statements made by the defendant; State's

Case called at 9:08 am (Clerk SF) (Case was set for Motion Hearing and FSSC)
Defendant John K Hoffman in court with Attorney David Zarwell. DA Susan V. Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Attorney Zarwell informs the Court that they are not settling the case today, no objection to the State's request to adjourn the trial date.
DA Happ informs the Court still believes that 2 days will be needed, just waiting for documents.
Court reminds defendant that the bond and conditions of bond remain in effect while the case is pending.

recess: 9:14 am
NEXT: (Notices to be mailed)
FSSC: 1/20/15 at 10:30 am
Jury Trial: 1/26/15 & morning of the 1/27/15  8:30 am
Motion hearing on December 9, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Jury trial on December 15 & 16, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Final status/scheduling conference on December 9, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on October 22, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Case called at 9:01 am [Clerk SH] (Case was scheduled for FSSC)
Defendant John K Hoffman in court with Attorney Joseph Francis Fischer. DA Susan V. Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court reviews STAO for withdrawl submitted by Atty Fischer; however proposed STAO was not submitted by State
Upon questioning of the Court, DA Happ informs the Court that the victim did not object to any continuances. Understand that Mr. Hoffman is eligible for SPD services. No objection to adjournment.
Upon questioning of the Court, Mr. Hoffman indicates that he would like Atty Fischer withdrawn. Confirms is eligible for SPD Representation.
Court presents basis and withdraws Atty Fischer from case & will reset matter on trial calendar
DA Happ informs the Court that there are a number of citizen witnesses in this case, requests trial be set for 2 days
Court charges Mr. Hoffman to inform SPD today of the upcoming scheduled dates
Court informs Mr. Hoffman that the deadline for plea is 12/9/14 FSSC date & that bond/conditions of bond remain in effect as case is pending
Recess: 9:07 am 

NEXT: (1) Schedule DA PTC 10/22/14 at 10:00 am - Send notices (2) Reschedule FSSC 12/9/14 at 9:00 am - Send notices (3) Reschedule JT 12/15-16/14 at 8:30 am - Send notices
Request to withdraw as counsel will be considered at the FSSC on 09-30-14 at 9am
Proposed STAO to withdraw as counsel (with cover letter)

Court's response to letter from defendant: The attorney is not allowed to withdraw unless he has permission from the Court. If such a request is made, a hearing will be scheduled at which time the client, the attorney and the DA will all be allowed to speak to the issue. cc: all
from Def. re: request for Atty Fischer to withdraw
Jury trial on October 6, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Final status/scheduling conference on September 30, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Defendant John K Hoffman in court with Attorney Joseph Francis Fischer. DA Susan V. Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Fischer: Parties have been unable to reach agreement, requests matter be set for trial
Counsel agree 1 day will  be needed for trial
Court confirms address in file is accurate for Mr. Hoffman

NEXT: (1) Schedule FSSC 9/30/14 at 9:00 am - Send notices (2) Schedule JT 10/6/14 at 8:30 am - Send notices
Status conference on August 29, 2014 at 10:00 am.

[Reserve Judge Robert Mawdsley presiding for BrIV]
Defendant John K Hoffman in court with Attorney Joseph Francis Fischer. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court examines the Defendant as to rights, understanding & intent.  
Mr. Hoffman waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Arraignment.
State files information

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--maximum penalties recited

Atty Fischer informs the Court that additional DA PTC is not needed, requests STC

Defendant John K Hoffman in court with attorney Joseph F Fischer.  Jeffrey M Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty. Fischer informs the Court that the parties are working on an agreement but additional time is needed to establish prior conviction information.

Status conference on June 27, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Case called at 9:38 am 
[Reserve Judge Neal Nettesheim presiding for BrIV]
Defendant John K Hoffman in court with Attorney Joseph F Fischer. DA Susan V Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Fischer: Have spoken to DA Happ on matter, part of offer is based upon out-state record that may or may not exist, still looking into this matter and need to make restitution up front. Both those may affect the offer. Anticipate will resolve matter short of trial by joint or argued recommendation. Request STC be set with anticipated Plea & Sentencing in 30 days.
DA Happ requests matter be set for preliminary hearing
Atty Fischer requests STC, confirms waiver of time limits and indicates possibility of matter being amended to misdemeanor. If no amendment, can waive preliminary hearing at plea.
Court reminds Mr. Hoffman that his bond/conditions of release remain in effect
Recess: 9:40 am 

NEXT: (1) Schedule STC (possible plea/sentencing) 6/27/14 at 1:30 pm - Send notices
Attorney Joseph F. Fischer (with cover letter)
Status conference on May 23, 2014 at 09:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on May 7, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Case called at 1:17 pm
Defendant John K Hoffman in custody, via video from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Joseph Francis Fischer. Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Upon stipulation, the Court finds the video connection to be sight and sound sufficient. 
Court verifies with the Defendant that the DOB and address listed on the criminal complaint are correct.
Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived; charges and maximum penalties recited
Court reviewed the Criminal Complaint and finds it states probable cause to support Count #1.
Bail/Bond recommendations presented by counsel.

Court requires $10,000.00 signature bond, with conditions: 
-No contact with Jack Vater, Brian Thompson or Paul Gieschen
-No presence at Bethesda Luthern Home in Watertown, Alter Metal Recycling in Beaver Dam or any other recycling or scrap metal yard

Attorney Fischer informs the Court that he will be submitting a notice of retainer later today.
Preliminary Hearing time limits waived by both parties.
The Court requests that Attorney Fischer ask the Jail to get the fingerprint card over to the Court.

Recess: 1:24 pm
NEXT: (Notices to be mailed)
PTC: 5/7/14 at 10:00 am
Status: 5/23/14 at 9:30 am
